entry.title: Extend a Custom Business Object created with Key User Extensibility using SAP Build Apps
entry.content:
This blog post covers how to setup an extension scenario from SAP S/4HANA Cloud and build Side-by-Side UI Extensions with the help of SAP Build Apps in the Business Technology Platform.

Business scenario:

A Manager wants to define business objects “Bonus Plan” for employees. A Bonus Plan is there to save employee specific rules for bonus entitlement.

Here, with Key User Extensibility, we create a custom Business Object with a data structure, logic for data initialization in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition which should have standard API operations (GET, POST, DELETE). Expose the custom business object as web service for side-by-side UI extension using Low-code No-code capabilities of SAP Build Apps. You will learn how quickly a new UI application can be developed with the no-code capabilities of SAP Build Apps. You will also find out what is the process to setup, develop and deploy a productive extension application.

Note: The maintain Bonus app shown in this blog is for educational purpose only and not meant for productive usage. It is not ensured that the data used in this extension scenario is managed in accordance with applicable legal requirements for all countries and industries and in accordance with the business needs, such as data life cycle requirements.  

Prerequisites:

  1. Subscription to SAP Build Apps on SAP BTP Sub-Account
  2. Your user needs (a) business role(s) with business catalogs Extensibility - Custom Business Objects (ID: SAP_CORE_BC_EXT_CBO), Extensibility - Custom Communication Scenarios (ID: SAP_CORE_BC_EXT_CCS) and Communication Management (ID: SAP_CORE_BC_COM) (Need to have unrestricted access if you are creating a business role and adding these catalogs).
  3. You have Created Custom Business Objects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud as per the given tutorial.                                                                

Why SAP Build Apps with SAP S/4HANA Cloud?

Create new solutions using the secure, no-code SAP Build Apps with SAP S/4HANA. Build visually and empower users to digitalise their daily work without impacting core processes. Create a personalised, accessible application that securely connects to data from SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

To extend SAP S/4HANA Cloud using SAP Build Apps, you can leverage side-by-side extensibility, which allows you to build extensions that run on SAP BTP and interact with your S/4HANA Cloud system. This approach enables you to create custom UIs, logic, and integrations without directly modifying the core S/4HANA Cloud system. 

 

SAP S/4HANA Cloud

Let’s start on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud side with the definition of the Custom Business Object and the communication settings.

Custom Business Object

In the Create Custom Business Objects in SAP S/4HANA Cloud tutorial group it is shown how to create a custom business object and generate a UI (user interface) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Expose Custom Business Object as External API

To integrate custom business object from SAP S/4HANA system with External Systems or Services like SAP Build Apps, as administrator you need to create a Communication Arrangement. You create a communication arrangement to enable the communication between your system and SAP Build App in BTP, and how they communicate. Communication Arrangement is formed by combining the below artifacts:

  1. Creating a Custom Communication Scenario
    The setup of the communication (inbound and outbound) between SAP S/4HANA and SAP BTP starts with the definition of a Custom Communication Scenario.
    The Custom Communication Scenario contains the information for both inbound and outbound HTTP-calls.
    • Open the app Custom Communication Scenarios in the Launchpad of the SAP S/4 HANA system and create a new Custom Communication Scenario with the name YY1_BONUSPLAN.

     

    • On the tab Inbound Services, you create an entry for your Custom Business Object: Press Add button to add inbound service “YY1_BONUSPLAN_CDS” and click select button. 

     

    • Press Save and Publish to finish the custom communication scenario creation.

     

  2. Creating a Communication System and User

    To enable secure communication between different systems you have to register these systems and define the user which is authorized to use the connection.

    The communication system represents the communication partner within a communication. for inbound communication, this is the external system that calls our custom Bonus plan service.

    We’ll create one Communication System for all systems that want to use our service as well as the user that they’ll have to use. If you want to access the custom BONUSPLAN OData service (Inbound) you also need to setup an authentication method. You can use several methods like e.g.., Basic Authentication, Certificate or OAuth.

    In this case we are choosing Basic Authentication for which you need to setup a Communication User. Open the app Maintain Communication Users from the Communication Management group and create there a new user with username, description, and password.

    • Open “Communication Systems” Application.
    • Start creating a new system by executing the “New” action.
    • Give following data to the new custom communication System…

    Note: you can replace XXX with your system ID.

    Field Label

    Field Value

    System ID

    EXTERNAL_SYSTEMXXX

    System Name

    EXTERNAL_SYSTEMXXX

    Host Name

    EXTERNAL_SYSTEMXXX

    • Scroll down to “User for Inbound Communication” and start adding one by executing the “Add” action.
    • In the Pop Up, use the value help to browse and select the user.

     

    • Choose the user you already created and then click OK. Your user for Inbound Communication is set up. Click on Save.

  3. Creating a Communication Arrangement for Custom Communication Scenario

Finally, a communication arrangement links the solution’s scenario with the Communication system and its user and exposes the Service to be used.

  • Open “Communication Arrangements” Application
  • Start creation by executing the “New” action.
  • A pop up opens in that you use the value help for Scenario first where you can select previously created Custom Communication Scenario YY1_BONUSPLAN. This will set the Scenario and default the Arrangement Name, so that you can continue the creation via “Create” button.

  • In the opening Arrangement details click to browse the Communication System
  • Choose the EXTERNAL_SYSTEMXXX you created before.
  • Choosing the system will automatically set the related User as well. Click Save to finish creation
  • Copy the Service URL for the next step. Here you save the inbound service URL for the destination configuration in BTP.

 

 

 

 

 


Build Side-by-Side UI Extensibility with SAP Build Apps

SAP Build Apps enables developers to implement loosely coupled extension applications securely on top of the existing SAP solution they already have. SAP Build Apps provides drag-and-drop capabilities for Citizen developers to build enterprise-grade applications confidently, authenticate and access SAP Business Technology Platform destinations. You can preview your SAP Build Apps project as web preview and can build it to deploy on SAP Build Work Zone or Android/IOS.

Here you will learn how to use SAP Build Apps, create an app that performs all the CRU (Create, Read, Update) operations for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud BONUSPLAN API for managing the Bonus Plan for the employee.

The point of this tutorial is to show you how you would perform all the CRU (Create, Read, Update) operations, and how you would handle some of the complexities of the SAP backend APIs (e.g. strict requirements for the data and handle multiple determination) for the Bonus plan scenario.

You will create an app with 2 pages:

  • Page 1: Display all Bonus plans
  • Page 2: Manage Bonus Plan, which handles Create or Update the bonus plan for employees.

Create destination to SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.   

In the SAP BTP cockpit, as administrator you need to create a destination to enable the communication to the S/4HANA Cloud system. In addition, the destination must be enabled for use in SAP Build Apps.

Procedure:

In the SAP BTP cockpit, navigate to your subaccount.

Choose Connectivity > Destination > Create Destination.

Choose Blank Template and enter the following data and click on Save.

Field

Value

Name

Enter the destination name.

Type

Select HTTP.

Description

Enter a description (SAP Build Apps to ABAP Callback Destination)

URL

Enter the Service URL saved during Communication Arrangement creation. If not saved access the communication arrangement

Proxy Type

Internet

Authentication

Select BasicAuthentication.

User

(Inbound) communication user used in the communication arrangement

Password

Set the password to the secret. Password of the (inbound) communication user used in the communication arrangement.

Additional Properties

Add the following properties:

“BuildApps.RequiresCsrf” → true

“AppgyverEnabled” → true

“HTML5.DynamicDestination ” → true

Save your entries.

 

 

 

 

 

 


Open SAP Build Apps

Open SAP Build Apps, by going to the SAP BTP cockpit, and under Instances and Subscriptions, click SAP Build Apps.

 

In the lobby of your SAP Build Apps, click Create.

 

Select Application.

 

Select Frontend and followed by this Select Web & Mobile Application and press Next button. Please note that the user needs to have access to the Custom Identity Provider to be able to create a Web & Mobile Application.

For the project name, enter Bonus plan Management and description as “Extend a key user extension from S/4HANA Cloud public edition “then click Create.

 

Connect to the REST API from the Custom Business Object on S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In this step, you will make a connection to the BONUSPLAN API of your SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. You will enable entities: BONUSPLAN (the header for a BONUSPLAN)

  1. Go to the Integrations tab.
  2. Click Add Integration.
  3. Click BTP Destinations, and then select the destination to your SAP S/4HANA Cloud BONUSPLAN API which you have created in “Create destination to SAP S/4HANA Cloud system” section.
  4. Select Click Install Integration (upper right).
  5. Under Data Entities, scroll down so you can see both YY1_BONUSPLAN and I_Currency. For each, select it and click Enable Data Entity.
  6. You can now select an entity and click Browse Real Data to see live data from SAP S/4HANA Cloud.


  7. Click Save (upper right).



Create page for displaying BONUSPLANs (Homepage)

Now you will create the home page that displays a list of Bonus Plans, for which the user can update the existing Bonus Plan and can create a new Bonus Plan.

  • You will already have a Home Page. Click on it.
  • Click Variables → Data Variables and create a data variable based on YY1_BONUSPLAN.

 

  • Click the User Interface tab to return to the UI canvas. 
  • Add a Title field and a Text field. Set the content for the text component as “Bonus plan details” and add a button with value “Create” value and list item component.


 

 

  • Add a List Item component

 

  • Click the list item, and configure its properties as follows:

Property

Value

Repeat with

data variable YY1_BONUSPLAN1

Primary label

data item in repeat current.EmployeeName

Secondary label

data item in repeat current.EmployeeID

 

Now you can test the application which should display the Bonus list by saving your changes and clicking on Preview to preview the application.

Hopefully you got this far and found success! Congratulations!!!

 

You will define the logic for the list item selection later once we finish next step (Create page for Manage Bonus Plan)

  • With the list item selected, open the logic canvas.
  • Add an Open page flow function, and configure it as follows:

Property

Value

Page

Manage Bonus Plan

Parameters → SAP_UUID

data item in repeat current.SAP_UUID

Parameters → EmployeeName

data item in repeat current. EmployeeName

 


You will define the logic for the Button later once we finish next step (Create page for Manage Bonus Plan)

  • Drag and drop an Open page flow function, and configure it as follows: Make sure that don’t bind any value to the page parameter of Manage Bonus Plan and Page value as “Manage Bonus Plan”.


Create page for Manage Bonus Plan

You will create a page for Manage Bonus Plan.

  • Click Add New Page, enter Manage Bonus Plan, and click OK.
  • Navigate to page Manage Bonus Plan
  • Click PAGE PARAMETERS and two parameter such as EmployeeName of type Text and SAP_UUID of type UUID.

 

 

  • Click Data Variables and create a variable for YY1_BONUSPLAN and Data Variable Type as “Single data record” and bind SAP_UUID value to the page parameter SAP_UUID.

 

 

  • Click View to return to the UI canvas and remove all the default components.
  • Add the following components in this order:
    • Title1
    • Text1
    • Title2
    • Container 1, and inside the container add
      • Input Field
      • CheckBox Field
  • Date field with input1(Date field can be installed from the marketplace if its not available by default)
  • Date field with input2
  • Container 2, and inside the container add          
        • Input Field1
        • Input Field2
  • Container 3, and inside the container add          
        • Input Field1
        • Input Field2
  • Container 4, and inside the container add          
        • Input Field1
        • Input Field2
  • Container 5, and inside the container add
        • Input Field1
        • Dropdown Field2
  • Button
  • Configure the following components:

Component

Property

Value

Title1

Content

Bonus plan

Text1

Content with formula

"Bonus plan for " +  IF(NOT(IS_NULLY(params.EmployeeName)), params.EmployeeName, "")

Title2

Content

General Information

Container 1

Layout

Horizontal

· Input field

With Data Variable YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ID

ID

Is Consistent

Label

Validity Start Date

FORMAT_DATETIME_LOCAL(DATETIME(NUMBER(SUBSTRING(data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ValidityStartDate, 6,19))), "YYYY.MM.DD")

 

Date field with input2

With Data Variable  YY1_BONUSPLAN1.TargetAmount_C

Button

Save

 

Add logic to Add/Update Bonus Plan:

  1. Now we will add the logic to the Save button. To achieve this, click on Save button and open its logic canvas.
  2. Add logic flow functions and connect them as in the following:
  3. Configure the flow functions as follows:
  • IF condition (first): Set the condition to the following formula (validates the SAP_UUID field):
    NOT(IS_NULLY(params.SAP_UUID))

Update record: Set the following:

  • Resource name: YY1_BONUSPLAN1
  • Risk ID: page parameter SAP_UUID
  • Record: Set the following formula (allows us to make sure the integer fields receive a number value):

{ ValidityStartDate: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ValidityStartDate, ValidityEndDate: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ValidityEndDate,LowBonusAssignmentFactor: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.LowBonusAssignmentFactor,HighBonusAssignmentFactor:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.HighBonusAssignmentFactor,LowBonusPercentage_V: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.LowBonusPercentage_V, HighBonusPercentage_V:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.HighBonusPercentage_V, EmployeeID: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.EmployeeID,  EmployeeName: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.EmployeeName, TargetAmount_V:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.TargetAmount_V, TargetAmount_C:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.TargetAmount_C}

 

Create record: Set the following:

  • Resource name: YY1_BONUSPLAN1
  • Record: Set the following formula:

{ SAP_UUID: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.SAP_UUID, ValidityStartDate: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ValidityStartDate, ValidityEndDate: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.ValidityEndDate,LowBonusAssignmentFactor: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.LowBonusAssignmentFactor,HighBonusAssignmentFactor:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.HighBonusAssignmentFactor,LowBonusPercentage_V: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.LowBonusPercentage_V, HighBonusPercentage_V:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.HighBonusPercentage_V, EmployeeID: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.EmployeeID,  EmployeeName: data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.EmployeeName, TargetAmount_V:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.TargetAmount_V, TargetAmount_C:data.YY1_BONUSPLAN1.TargetAmount_C}

 

You can set the Toast and Alert flow functions for both Create record and Update record with the appropriate Text message to inform the user about the success or error message during Save.

Now you can now test the application, which is designed to display all available Bonus plans. If you select an existing Bonus Plan, the system will load all relevant field values for the chosen employee, allowing you to update those details. Additionally, you can create a new Bonus Plan by using the Create button and by following the steps mentioned in the section Test app.

Thanks, you have completed SAP Build Apps application development by extending a Custom Business Object successfully! 😊Congratulations!!!

Test app

  • Open the Preview Portal using the Preview button located in the top-right corner.
  • Go to the Launch tab, then Open Preview Portal, then Web Preview.

 

  • Click Bonus Plan to open the app. You should see the first page with a list of Bonus Plan in the first page and while navigating to the Manage Bonus Plan page handles Create or Update the bonus plan for employees.

For Deploying an app created with SAP Build Apps to HTML5 applications repository on SAP BTP and Integrate an SAP Build Apps application into SAP Build Work Zone, please do refer to this tutorial.

entry.title: Why Clean Core matters - Get some insights into our brand new Extensibility Whitepaper
entry.content:
What is “clean core”?

Let’s dive a bit deeper to understand what exactly this means: An SAP S/4HANA Cloud solution has a clean core when it is up to date, documented, unmodified, consistent, efficient, and has custom extensions decoupled from SAP source code.

The clean core concept has multiple dimensions:

  • Business Processes: reduce complexity, because complex processes slow down upgrade cycles
  • Extensibility: decouple extensions from the standard
  • Data: control the data to the latest standards, with respect to volume, cleanliness, accuracy
  • Integration: keep your IT landscape reliable and flexible, using standard APIs and events
  • Operations: keep your operations effective and efficient

In this blog post, we will focus on the method for maintaining this clean core while adapting SAP solutions to meet specific business needs, which is called “clean core extensibility”. Flexibility will continue to benefit you in the future if extensions are built and utilized in adherence to clean core principles. For this, SAP provides the private cloud extensibility model for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

Note: The clean core concept only applies to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, as the Public Cloud Edition cannot be customized in its source code, only extended. For the public cloud, SAP provides the public cloud extensibility model for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, which also leverages the SAP BTP.

Now, back to extending SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

 

What Is New: The Evolution Of The 3-Tier Model – Introducing The Clean Core Level Concept

SAP is evolving its extensibility guidelines by introducing the Clean Core Level Concept, a new model designed to simplify qualification criteria and provide a more pragmatic approach to managing custom code in SAP S/4HANA, now including rules for classic ABAP. By evolving the previous 3-tier model, this new maturity model categorizes extensions into four distinct levels (A, B, C, and D) based on their architectural integrity, upgrade safety, and alignment with clean core principles.

This allows for a more granular assessment of an extension's quality and upgrade stability, rather than a simple binary "clean" or "unclean" decision. The core recommendation remains a "BTP-first" strategy, aiming for the highest possible level, but the new model acknowledges the realities of complex, grown system landscapes and allows customers to  personalize their clean core journeys. The fundamental principles of Clean Core—decoupling extensions from the standard SAP code to ensure upgrade stability—remain essential.

How It Works: The Four Clean Core Levels Explained

According to the Clean Core Level Concept, each extension is evaluated using a standardized methodology that looks at how the extension is built, how well it is decoupled from the core, and how easily it can be upgraded or maintained. Here are the key details of the Clean Core Level Concept:

Overview of Clean Core Levels

The Clean Core Level Concept categorizes extensions into four distinct levels (A, B, C, and D), each representing varying degrees of compliance with Clean Core principles:

  1. Level A : Extend with SAP Build

    • Description: Extensions in this level are fully compliant with Clean Core principles and interact with SAP standard functionality through publicly released interfaces and extension points.
    • Characteristics:
      • Side-by-Side: Developed on SAP BTP, utilizing all options of the SAP Build portfolio including AI-powered pro-code and low-code tools.
      • On-Stack: Built within the SAP S/4HANA system using the ABAP Cloud development model with released APIs.
    • Benefits: Maximum upgrade stability and alignment with SAP's clean core vision.

  2. Level B : Leverage Classic APIs

    • Description: Extensions at this level can access "classic APIs" from SAP, in addition to meeting Level A criteria.
    • Characteristics:
      • These APIs are well-defined, documented, and generally upgrade-stable but do not come with formal stability contracts.
      • Classic technologies and frameworks can be used, which have a long-standing history of reliable use.
    • Benefits: Broader scope for process enhancements compared to Level A while maintaining a degree of upgrade stability.

  3. Level C : Access Internal Objects

    • Description: Extensions classified as Level C can access internal SAP objects that are not officially released or supported.
    • Characteristics:
      • These objects may lack documentation and long-term stability guarantees.
      • A changelog for SAP objects is provided to help customers assess upgrade risks proactively.
    • Benefits: Offers flexibility for legacy scenarios but poses notable risks regarding future upgrade stability.

  4. Level D : Not Recommended Extensions

    • Description: Extensions in this category use objects or techniques that SAP has explicitly marked as "not recommended."
    • Characteristics:
      • Includes modifications to SAP standard code, implicit enhancements, and direct write access to SAP tables.
      • Represents the highest risk and the most significant technical debt.
    • Consequences: These extensions threaten system stability and upgradeability and should be prioritized for immediate remediation.

Importance of the Level Concept

  • Granular Assessment: The level concept allows for a more nuanced evaluation of extensions compared to a binary "clean" or "unclean" decision. This granularity helps organizations understand the specific risks associated with their custom code.
  • Guidance for Development: By categorizing extensions into levels, developers can make informed decisions about which technologies and practices to adopt, aiming for the highest possible level of compliance.
  • Facilitating Modernization: The framework supports organizations in managing their existing codebases effectively, helping them prioritize remediation of the highest-risk extensions (Level D) while promoting the adoption of clean, upgrade-stable practices.

Conclusion

The Clean Core Level Concept is essential for organizations leveraging SAP S/4HANA, offering a clear framework to assess and categorize custom extensions. By distinguishing between Levels A, B, C, and D, it enables businesses to make informed development decisions, prioritize remediation of high-risk extensions, and ensure compliance with Clean Core principles. This structured approach not only helps manage technical debt but also simplifies upgrades and enhances overall system integrity, paving the way for sustained agility and innovation. Embracing this framework is key to maintaining a robust and future-ready ERP landscape.

Leverage SAP Build for creating extensions

The go-to place following SAP-recommended best practices to create extensions optimized for SAP software development is SAP Build. It includes

  • powerful low-code, pro-code (ABAP, Java, JavaScript), and generative AI capabilities
  • enhanced interoperability with SAP S/4HANA

to empower developers and business experts to create extensions for SAP software with greater efficiency. It allows you to accelerate ERP modernization, foster innovation, and automate processes – all within a single comprehensive suite of solutions.

 

Accelerate extension of SAP S/4HANA with AI capabilities enabled by Joule

New levels of Cloud ERP efficiency can be unlocked with the latest AI capabilities enabled by Joule in SAP Build. Joule is SAP’s AI copilot offering conversational interactions in the respective business context. Uniquely trained on SAP data and processes, it helps developers write code and design workflows for SAP S/4HANA across ABAP, Java, JavaScript, and low-code tools. As an integral part of SAP Build, Joule is the copilot for SAP development and makes developers more efficient with their development tasks for SAP S/4HANA.

Joule generates high-quality code and code explanations aligned with SAP’s programming models, thereby reducing development time for both new and experienced developers and accelerating migration to cloud ERP with a clean core.

AI capabilities enabled by Joule can also be used to extend ERP through low-code application development. Joule assists with process automation, expediting the creation of workflows for SAP S/4HANA and guiding workflow approvers with automated recommendations.

How to Get Started?

First and foremost, read our white paper on Clean core extensibility for SAP S/4HANA Cloud . The last chapter of the document details the six-step path to a clean core and links to many useful resources to deep dive:

  1. Start with the clean core concept and definition
  2. Apply the concept and create your specific clean core strategy
  3. Analyze existing custom code (brownfield only)
  4. Adopt extension guidelines and methodologies
  5. Establish clean core governance and operations
  6. Build extensions

In addition, depending of the line of business you’re involved in, read our eBook presenting how to Extend SAP S/4HANA with SAP Build with use cases by LoB, including Finance, Supply chain, Sales and service, Operations and IT.

And regarding the use of SAP Build for extending your ERP, I recommend watching the replay of our SAP Build Live online event on Clean Core extensibility with SAP Build held on October 23, where our partner LeverX shared insights from a real customer use case.

For ABAP-based extensibility for clean core see the ABAP Extensibility Guide.

Finally, we have a learning journey for you:

Managing Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud will present you how to evaluate and apply clean core principles to ERP so that they can maximize business process agility, reduce adaptation efforts, and accelerate innovation. It is for beginners, takes 2 hours and is free.

Now you're ready to begin your fruitful journey to achieve Clean Core!

entry.title: SAP BTP Hackathon at SAPHILA 2025: Celebrating the Winners and Innovation in Action
entry.content:
A few months ago, we shared our excitement about the launch of the first-ever SAP BTP Hackathon in Africa in joined collaboration of AFSUG and SAP, highlighting the unique opportunity it offered for AFSUG members to bring their creativity and problem-solving skills to the forefront of the SAP community. Now, with the event behind us, it’s time to reflect on what unfolded and celebrate the teams and ideas that made this inaugural Hackathon truly special.

From Ideation to Demo Jam: A Journey of Collaboration

As outlined in the previous blog, the hackathon was more than just a competition, it was a journey. Eighteen teams, representing a broad cross-section of AFSUG members, embarked on an eight-week sprint, supported by SAP BTP experts and coaches. The focus was on building real-world solutions using SAP BTP components like SAP Build, SAP HANA Cloud, SAP Integration Suite and ABAP Cloud amongst other SAP BTP based Services & Solutions.

After intensive enablement and development sessions, three teams emerged as finalists and were invited to present their solutions live at SAPHILA 2025’s Demo Jam. The energy in the room was palpable as each team showcased how SAP BTP could be harnessed to solve pressing business challenges.

And the Winner Is… PwC South Africa!

In a closely contested finale, the SAPHILA audience voted PwC South Africa as the overall winner for their AI-driven legal services platform “Legal Ease”. This solution stood out for its innovative use of AI to simplify legal document processing and understanding, a pain point for many businesses and consumers alike. “Legal Ease” enables users to scan and summarize complex contracts, ask questions in natural language, and receive clear, actionable insights. The platform even supports translation into local languages and integrates with knowledge bases for related services.

What impressed both the jury and the audience was not just the technical sophistication, but the clear business value: “Legal Ease” addresses real frustrations around contract transparency, billing and accessibility, with the potential to transform how legal services are delivered in Africa and beyond.

Honouring the Finalists: Debswana Diamond Company and Bell Equipment

Let’s not forget the other two finalists, who also delivered outstanding solutions:

  • Debswana Diamond Company tackled overtime management with an AI-powered assistant that streamlines scheduling, reduces costs and supports employee well-being.
  • Bell Equipment automated shipment tracking and document processing, helping to prevent stock shortages and improve logistics efficiency.

Both teams demonstrated the breadth of innovation possible with SAP BTP and set a high bar for future Hackathons.

Reflections and What’s Next

The Hackathon’s main objective was to foster deep collaboration between SAP and its customers, giving local teams a hands-on opportunity to explore and build with SAP BTP. The quality and diversity of solutions, especially the creative use of AI and automation, highlight the immense potential within the African SAP community.

Amanda Gibbs, CEO of AFSUG, summed it up perfectly:

“It is inspiring to witness what can be achieved in just eight weeks using SAP BTP;

we’ve seen incredible progress and innovation.”

Join the Conversation

Congratulations again to all teams who participated and especially to PwC South Africa for their winning solution! If you were inspired by the SAP BTP Hackathon or have thoughts on how SAP BTP can drive innovation in your organization, I’d love to hear from you in the comments.

And if you missed out this year, keep an eye out for future SAP BTP Hackathons - this is just the beginning!

entry.title: SAP Build Work Zone Gets Even More Powerful with AI-Powered Capabilities
entry.content:
In today’s dynamic business environment, where speed and precision are critical to success, the ability to access, create, and act on information quickly has become a competitive advantage. That’s why we’re excited to introduce the latest AI-powered capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. They are designed to help your organization unlock greater productivity and smarter collaboration.  

With the addition of AI-based text generation, summarization, and comment generation, you can now accelerate content creation, quickly distill key insights from lengthy documents, and actively engage with workspace content, all directly within your digital workplace. 

As SAP Build Work Zone continues to evolve into an intelligent digital workspace, these new features bring built-in intelligence that reduces manual effort, accelerates decision-making, and enhances the overall employee experience.  

 

AI promotional model 

To help you explore these new capabilities, we’re offering them under a promotional model (totally free of charge) until December 31, 2025. During this period, each global account is entitled to 100,000 AI requests per calendar month across all instances of SAP Build Work Zone, advanced edition. If the monthly quota is exceeded, users will receive a notification. The quota resets at the start of each month. 

After the promotional period ends, AI features will be available under a commercial model of SAP AI core. If you choose not to activate the commercial offering, the features will be automatically disabled. 

 

Availability 

The AI capabilities are powered by SAP AI Core and are available in the following data centers: 

  • AWS: Australia (Sydney), Brazil (São Paulo), Europe (Frankfurt), Europe (Frankfurt EU Access), Japan (Tokyo), Singapore, US East (VA) 
  • Microsoft Azure: Australia (Sydney), Europe (Netherlands), US East (VA) 
  • Google Cloud: Australia Southeast (Sydney), Europe (Frankfurt), India (Mumbai), KSA (Dammam – KSA Regulated Customers), US Central (IA) 

 

Enabling the AI features  

These AI-powered features can be enabled in the admin console. To get started, follow these simple steps: 

Step 1: Submit a Support Ticket 

Open a support ticket on component LOD-SF-SWZ requesting AI enablement for your subaccount. Make sure to include your environment details, which you can copy from the Admin Console > Overview screen using the Copy Info button. 

Step 2: Enable AI in the Admin Console 

Navigate to Administration Console > Feature Enablement > Features. Here you can select the AI features you want to activate. You’ll be prompted to review and accept the terms and conditions before proceeding. 

 

Explore the new AI features 

Once enabled using the steps above, you’ll find these capabilities integrated seamlessly into your workpages and workspace tools.  

1. AI Summarization 

This feature allows you to get the gist of long documents within seconds. AI Summarization helps you to condense large chunks of content such as wikis, blogs, workpages, and documents, into concise summaries.  

To summarize a content item, navigate to the workspace’s Content list from the navigation bar and select the document you want to process. When the content is open, click the Summarize button located at the top of the screen.  

The AI will then generate a summary that captures the key points of the original text.  

This feature supports content up to 100K words, making it a perfect tool for quickly grasping the essentials without having to read through long texts. 

2. AI Text Generation 

With this feature you can create compelling content with a few simple prompts. This feature helps you generate contextual text directly within your workpages. It is great for drafting introductions, elaborating ideas, or kickstarting any type of content. 

To use it, simply click on Add within a cell in your workspace and choose Generate Text from the dropdown menu.  

 

A dialog box will appear where you can enter your prompt. 

Based on this input, AI will generate relevant text, which may take a few moments to appear. Once the text is generated, you can further fine-tune the content to suit your style and requirements. Once you are satisfied you have the option to accept it, discard it, or generate a new version.  

3. AI Comment Generation 

Using this feature you can respond intelligently with AI-suggested comments. AI Comment Generation simplifies the process of engaging with content through contextual comments.  

To put this feature, open the Content list and select the specific content item you’d like to respond to. At the bottom of the screen, the AI icon can help you generate text with AI.  

Here you can enter a prompt or context.  

AI will then suggest relevant comment options for you to accept, discard or retry.

You can use this feature to contribute to discussions, provide feedback, or interact with colleagues. The same text generation experience is available when writing a news feed as well.

***** 

These AI-powered enhancements are just the beginning. At SAP, we're committed to helping you work more intelligently, engage more effectively, and innovate faster. Stay tuned as we continue to expand the AI capabilities in SAP Build Work Zone, empowering your teams like never before. 

 

Learn more: 

➤ SAP Build Work Zone on: sap.com / SAP Community

➤ SAP Application Development and Automation Community Group

➤ Joule is available in SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition

entry.title: Demo Jam @ SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore | Nov 25–26, 2025 | BIEC
entry.content:
Bring Your Ideas to Life 

The wait is over – Demo Jam is back at SAP TechEd On Tour, happening on November 25–26 in Bangalore! This is your chance to wow customers and partners in the audience, showcase your most innovative SAP-powered solution, and prove your skills in a high-energy live showdown. 

What’s SAP Demo Jam? 

Think of it as the ultimate live demo battle - no slides, no filler. Just six minutes of pure creativity and innovation, live on stage. The winner? Chosen by the audience using our applause-o-meter. 
(Need ideas? Check out the 2023 SAP DemoJam Highlights.) 

Rules 

  • Time Limit: Exactly 6 minutes - go over and the buzzer cuts you off.
  • Live Demo Only: No PPTs, no screenshots, no videos, no AI-generated entertainment -only real, working solutions.
  • Tech Focus: Must show how you used SAP BTP (incl. SAP Build, APAB, SAP Integration Suite, HANA Cloud), SAP Business Data Cloud, and/or SAP Business AI to solve a real business problem.
  • Team Size: 2 presenters on stage.

How to Submit Your Proposal 

Email TechEdonTourBangalore2025@sap.com

Subject : SAP Demo Jam - SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore 2025 

Details : 

  • Name of your demo 
  • Detailed description of your demo 
  • Business value you’re demonstrating (max 500 words) 
  • Technology used 
  • Presenter #1: Name, Email, Company, Job profile 
  • Presenter #2: Name, Email, Company, Job profile 
  • (Optional) Link to a short demo video 

Deadline: September 15, 2025 

What Happens Next? 

  • Selection of Finalists: Six teams will be chosen by an SAP expert panel and announced on September 25, 2025. 
  • Complimentary Tickets: Finalist presenters get complimentary SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore tickets (travel & expenses not included). 
  • Live Demo: On November 26, finalists take the stage-two presenters per team-to battle it outlive.

Bring your ideas. Bring your energy. Bring your innovation. 

Let’s Jam, Bangalore!

entry.title: SAP Platform and Data Summit 2025: Unlock the Future of Innovation | Register Now
entry.content:
SAP Platform and Data Summit 2025: Unlock the Future of Innovation with SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Business Data Cloud | Register Now

Hello, SAP Community!

My name is Joanne Koh-Stewart, and I'm Director of Product Marketing for SAP Business Technology Platform. As we navigate an era where enterprise data management isn't just an asset—it's the foundation of every strategic decision—business leaders face an unprecedented challenge: How do you transform mountains of information into meaningful competitive advantage?

According to recent IDC research, organizations that successfully harness the power of SAP Business Technology Platform with business applications reported achieving annual benefits worth $13.88 million per organization on average. Yet, many businesses find themselves drowning in data complexity, struggling to connect the dots between various business applications, processes, and other IT investments for tangible business outcomes.

That's precisely why I'm thrilled to invite you to the SAP Platform and Data Summit 2025—an exclusive gathering designed for pioneering business leaders and IT experts ready to unlock the transformative power of intelligent data strategies with SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Business Data Cloud.

 

The Reality Check: Where Most Organizations Stand Today

Picture this scenario that's playing out in boardrooms across industries. Your organization has invested millions in digital transformation initiatives. You've implemented many applications required for your business, collected vast amounts of data, and are now hopefully looking into utilizing various AI tools. Yet when you want to optimize business processes, increase sales, engage customers, and elevate employee experience, you’re lost on where to start.

Sound familiar? The challenge isn't technology—it's the strategic alignment of SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Business Data Cloud with real business objectives. You're sitting on a goldmine of data, but the path to extracting value feels fragmented across different systems, departments, and decision-making processes.

The key lies in creating an intelligent, unified ecosystem where your SAP and non-SAP data, applications, and AI capabilities work in harmony. SAP BTP, coupled with SAP BDC and SAP Business AI, doesn't just solve technical challenges—it fundamentally reshapes how your organization thinks, learns, and competes in the market.

 

What Makes This Summit Different: Customer-Led Innovation

Unlike typical vendor conferences, the SAP Platform and Data Summit puts customer success stories at the center. You'll hear directly from IT decision-makers and business leaders who have navigated similar challenges you're facing today. These aren't theoretical case studies—they're battle-tested strategies with real business value.

The two-day format is intentionally designed for deep engagement. Day 1 focuses on hearing from customers and partners’ success stories, while Day 2 dives into collaborative workshops to learn and ideate. You'll leave not just with inspiration, but with concrete next steps tailored to your organization's unique digital transformation journey.

 

Four Essential Topic Tracks You'll Explore at the Summit

On Day 2, dedicated tracks are offered to address the most pressing challenges facing organizations today in a workshop setting. Each track combines strategic insights with practical implementation guidance from customers who have successfully navigated these transformations.


BTP for Clean Core
You: Your organization is managing a complex landscape of customizations that make system upgrades challenging and expensive. Every enhancement seems to create technical debt, and you're concerned about maintaining agility while preserving critical business functionality.
The Solution: Learn how SAP BTP enables you to extend SAP applications without compromising your core system integrity. Through customer success stories, you'll discover how organizations are leveraging the clean core principles to innovate rapidly while maintaining upgrade readiness and reducing long-term maintenance costs.

BUILD-ing AI Applications & Extensions
You: Your business needs and processes aren't always met by standard applications, but custom development is time-consuming and resource-intensive. Meanwhile, your development teams are under pressure to deliver solutions faster while maintaining quality, security, and scalability.
The Solution: Explore how SAP Build empowers both professional developers and business users to create applications and extensions rapidly. See real examples of organizations using low-code development to bridge capability gaps, automate processes, and create tailored user experiences that drive business value.

AI & Joule
You: Despite the industry's significant importance and heavy investment in AI initiatives, your organizations struggle to move beyond pilot projects to enterprise-scale implementations that deliver measurable business impact.
The Solution: Discover how SAP Business AI and Joule are revolutionizing business processes across industries. Through customer presentations, you'll witness how AI is being utilized to improve business workflows, enhance decision-making, automate complex tasks, and provide intelligent insights that drive strategic outcomes.

Business Data Cloud
You: Your organization has access to vast amounts of data from different systems, but each source speaks a different "language." Without a unified semantic model, your data remains fragmented and difficult to interpret, limiting your ability to leverage advanced analytics and planning capabilities that could transform your business performance.
The Solution: Learn how SAP Business Data Cloud harmonizes heterogeneous data into a coherent, business-ready semantic model with SAP Datasphere. Explore customer examples of organizations that have transformed disconnected data into actionable insights, enabling sophisticated analytics, predictive planning, and strategic decision-making across the enterprise with SAP Analytics Cloud.

 

Register Now: Space is Limited (and FREE!)

The Summit isn't just about learning new technologies—it's about positioning your organization to lead in the data-driven economy that's already here.

🌉Register for San Francisco →| September 11–12, 2025
Customer Presenters: AMD, Siemens Healthineers, Clorox, and more
Celebrity Speaker: Andre Iguodala

🏙️Register for NYC →| September 16–17, 2025
Celebrity Speaker: Bernie Williams, former NY Yankee and 4x World Series champion
Customer Presenters: Moderna, Johnson & Johnson, Conair, and others

🏢Register for Chicago → | September 23–24, 2025
Celebrity Speaker: Former Chicago Bear Matt Forte
Customer Presenters: Southern California Edison, Endress+Hauser, Rust-Oleum, and others

🍁Register for Toronto → | October 16–17, 2025
Celebrity Speaker: NHL celebrity speaker to be announced soon
Customer Presenters: Metrie and others

🍑Register for Atlanta → | October 22–23, 2025
Celebrity Speaker: Celebrity speaker to be announced soon
Customer Presenters: Colgate, Lucid Motors, Gerdau, and more

Whether you're at the beginning of your SAP journey or looking to maximize existing investments, this Summit will provide the strategic clarity, practical insights, and professional connections to accelerate your transformation.

Register now and join the exclusive community of leaders who are turning data complexity into competitive simplicity.

 

Let's Connect

I'll be attending the Summit in Chicago this year, and I look forward to connecting with fellow transformation leaders! Come prepared with your toughest platform and data challenges—this is your opportunity to collaborate with peers who are solving similar problems and SAP experts who can provide immediate guidance.

Now let's hear from you:

  • What's your biggest obstacle in scaling your platform and data initiatives?
  • How are you currently measuring the ROI of your SAP investments?
  • What would success look like if you could unlock the full potential of your enterprise data?

Share your thoughts in the comments, and let's start the conversation before we meet in person!

entry.title: The Complete Joule Studio Resource Hub: Everything You Need to Get Started
entry.content:
Access Joule Studio from the SAP Build Lobby.

 

Joule Studio, the latest capability in SAP Build, is a low-code/no-code environment designed for creating, deploying, and managing custom Joule agents and skills. These agents and skills, which are deeply grounded in business data, allow developers to optimize rule-based and dynamic workflows and drive precise business outcomes. Joule Studio offers an open and extensible framework to infuse agentic intelligence into business workflows that span across SAP and non-SAP systems.  

Since July, Joule Studio is generally available (GA) with the skill builder capability. This blog is your practical guide that compiles all the resources you need to understand the product and get started on building agentic AI in a structured way.   

Here’s a recommended step-by-step approach: 

  • Start with overview resources such as announcements and short videos to gain conceptual clarity 
  • Deepen your understanding with technical blogs and guided experiences 
  • Move to structured courses and other learning materials for hands-on experience. 
  • Try the live product 

 

Getting introduced 

Every product journey starts with a curiosity - what is the product, and why should I care? This phase is all about getting conceptual understanding about Joule Studio and its capabilities:   

  • Joule Studio Announcement Blog – Read the official announcement on what is being released and when 
  • Joule Studio Product Video – Two minutes overview of Joule Studio, showcasing its capabilities and unique value in enabling skills and agents for workflows across SAP and non-SAP systems 
  • Joule Studio: custom Joule skills GA blog - Read the GA announcement for the skill builder. Understand characteristics and step-to-step process for building a skill 
  • On-Demand Webinar – Watch the on-demand webinar to go a little deeper, understand key agentic AI use cases, and get a sneak peek at product capabilities: skill builder and agent builder with a demo  

 

Seeing Joule Studio in action 

Once you know what Joule Studio does, the next step is to see it in action. Watching real demos and guided experiences helps you visualize where it fits into everyday business tasks and what it can achieve: 

  • Guided Product Tour – Take a guided tour of Joule Studio to explore how you can build AI agents and Joule Skills with drag and drop simplicity to achieve specific business outcomes 
  • Interactive Value Journey: Skill Builder – See how to configure a Joule skill to connect SAP SuccessFactors with a third-party payroll system 
  • Interactive Value Journey: Agent Builder Vision – Design agents that plan, adapt, and act autonomously 
  • Custom Joule skill creation – demo video - Learn how to create a Joule skill to create an ID badge in a third-party system after a preliminary check in an SAP system 
  • Learning Journey: Introducing Joule Studio in SAP Build – learning course on Joule Studio and its capabilities 

 

Explore the product hands on 

 Ready to dig in? This phase is all about experiencing the product hands on. Here’s where you start experimenting, take on learning missions, and build skills at your own pace: 

  • Discovery Center Mission – Best practices for connecting systems and scaling your Joule skills 
  • Developer Tutorial: Build Your First Joule Skill – Deploy your first custom Joule skill that retrieves employee information from one system and uses that information in another system 

 

Get started  

This phase provides you essential documentation to help you set up and get started with Joule Studio: 

  • Partner spotlights - before you get started on your own use case, read about real world Agentic AI use cases and their implementation by our partners: Redwood, Pricefx, LeverX, and Sovanta  
  • How to get started blog - understand the step-to-step process: prerequisites, commercial details, and technical setup 
  • FAQ blog - answers to your frequently asked questions  
  • Technical Set up guide - technical set up needed to access Joule Studio within SAP Build 

 

Closing remarks

With this organized set of resources, you have everything you need - from understanding the product to getting fully set up. Whether you’re a beginner or advanced developer, these materials are designed to support you and answer your questions at every step. We can't wait to hear what you build with Joule Studio in SAP Build!

entry.title: Unlock SAP Joule for Developers—Claim Your Free Access Today
entry.content:
Try SAP Joule for Developers—Now Available for Free 

We have recently introduced powerful new Joule capabilities for developers across SAP Build Code, SAP Build Process Automation, SAP Build Apps, and ABAP environment. These AI features are designed to accelerate development, boost productivity, and bring intelligence into the tools you already use. 

Now’s the perfect time to try them. SAP Joule for Developers is available for free. Once the free offer ends, a commercial model based on AI Units will apply—so don’t miss this opportunity to explore what’s possible with AI in your SAP development tools. 

 Quick reminder: A valid license for SAP Build or ABAP is required to use the AI capabilities in those environments. 

 

What is SAP Joule for Developers? 

Announced on March 18, SAP Joule for Developers is a package of embedded AI capabilities powered by Joule and available within: 

  • SAP Build Code 
  • SAP Build Process Automation 
  • SAP Build Apps 
  • ABAP Environment 

These tools now help you generate code from natural language, automate processes faster, and build apps more efficiently—all with AI integrated directly into the experience. 

We’ll walk through the setup steps in an upcoming section. But first, here are some helpful resources to catch up on the latest: 

  • Read the Announcement
  • Explore the Technical Overview
  • Check out the FAQs

 

Customer Success

See how early adopters are already transforming their work with SAP Joule for Developers: 

“Joule for Developers dramatically boosts productivity by enabling developers to quickly generate enterprise-grade apps, including logic, data models, sample data, and test scripts. It serves as a virtual guide to assist developers during design-time and helps resolve local testing exceptions efficiently.” — Gerard Van Paassen, CEO at Aarini Consulting 

“Joule for Developers not only generates data models but also makes it simple to design Fiori UIs and enrich test data—resulting in a major productivity boost across our development lifecycle.” — Michael Brand, Senior Consultant at FIS 

“PwC uses Joule for Developers in SAP Build to rapidly deliver innovative SAP solutions. Its generative AI supercharges our developers’ output, helping us accelerate award-winning ESG solutions while extending SAP S/4HANA and other enterprise apps—without compromising the clean core.” — Dr. Nicholas Nicoloudis, Global Head of SAP Innovation at PwC 

From accelerating application generation to streamlining code optimization, customers are seeing measurable time savings, higher productivity, and better quality in their SAP extension development projects. 

Stay tuned as we share more customer experiences—yours could be next. Try SAP Joule for Developers today while it’s free. 

 

Activate AI capabilities in SAP Build: 

Now, let’s walk through how to enable the AI capabilities in SAP Build. 

Note: AI capabilities in SAP Build Code have already been enabled and available for use in the environment. The instructions below applies to SAP Build Process Automation and SAP Build Apps.

 2. Select Generative AI from the settings canvas. 

 3. Toggle the Enable Generative AI button

 5. Verify that the AI features are enabled 

 

 

Activate AI capabilities in ABAP Environment: 

Note: For existing customers, they will need to reorder the $0 SKU to continue using the ABAP AI capabilities.

 

A. For Customers: 

1. Contact your Account Executive to purchase the SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities license (SKU ID: 8019124). The AE will create an order containing the license material. 

2. Once the purchase is complete, ABAP development systems will be enabled for ABAP AI capabilities within 48 hours. 

3. To start using Joule capabilities in ABAP, ensure you have the required authorizations. For details, see the documentation and screenshot below.

 

B. For Partners: 

1. Get the TDD ABAP AI capabilities license (SKU ID 8019541):  

  • Go to Manage My Services App 
  • Add the SKU to an existing order, e.g. Pay-as-you-go (see screenshots below). 

2. Once the purchase is complete, ABAP development systems will be enabled for ABAP AI capabilities within 48 hours. 

3. To start using Joule capabilities in ABAP, ensure you have the required authorizations. For details, see the documentation and screenshot below.

 

Start leveraging the power of AI today!  

Enable SAP Joule for Developers and experience a significant boost in your development efficiency. Don't miss out on the free offer! 

 #SAPJouleForDevelopers #SAPBuild #ABAPCloud #SAPBusinessTechnologyPlatform

entry.title: Triggering Process in Shared Environment from SAP Build Apps - Better Solution 😸
entry.content:
In my previous blog post Triggering Process in Shared Environments from SAP Build Apps,  I showed you how to trigger from SAP Build Apps a process that was deployed to a shared environment  -- using HTTP Destination Request instead of Processes flow functions.

Though I thought it was pretty easy -- and I liked it because I could control the API call and see what was going on under the hood -- it still required me to know the APIs as well as to give up on some of the cool SAP Build Apps capabilities that come with the Processes flow functions (like automatic generation of schemas from inputs/outputs of a process).

Thanks to @KuroKen, I discovered a better way, who commented on my original post.

At first I struggled to get the solution to work, even though I was assured it worked. But as usual, the struggling was good and revealed all kinds of additional nuances about the system (see Issues below). After 2 weeks of study, here's my explanation of this solution.

The Problem (reminder)

SAP Build Apps has a wonderful set of flow functions that makes it easy to trigger processes (and run other SAP Build Process Automation APIs). 

But the problem is that they were developed before SAP Build environments was a big thing, and certainly before the Public environment was deprecated. The API to trigger a process in a shared environment requires a query parameter specifying the environment, but the flow functions do not include this parameter and therefore the flow function can only trigger Public processes, which as we said are deprecated.

🙀

The Solution

Well, it is pretty simple -- don't require the query parameter.

But how?

When creating the SAP Build Process Automation instance in the SAP BTP cockpit, you can add a small configuration  that will assign that instance to a specific shared environment so you will not have to pass the environment name when you call the API.

To set up SAP Build Process Automation, you need to create an instance of the service. In the cockpit click Create.

You select SAP Build Process Automation, and select the standard instance plan. 

Instead of clicking Create, click Next so you can add a configuration to specify a shared environment to connect to this instance. In the dialog, you enter an environment ID and an API key with rights to trigger processes and more.

The following is the dialog where you post your configuration:

The following is an example of the JSON to set (you need to replace with your own environment ID and API key):

{
    "environmentId": "salesgroup",
    "apiKey": "fPdjgABCD-wZUckjh-c6e2wFyU3SgL"
}

 If you already have an instance, you can run Update and then supply the JSON.

Some of this process is described here: https://help.sap.com/docs/build-process-automation/sap-build-process-automation/update-service-instance

Environment ID

The environment ID can be found when you go to Control Tower and open your environment, under Identifier.

API Key

Within the environment, you can go to the API Keys tab and create a new API key.

For the key you must give it enough scope for triggering processes, specifically the environment_read, trigger_read and trigger_execute scopes.

 

How You Trigger Process from SAP Build Apps

Now that we have overcome the problem with shared environments, here's a quick review of how to trigger a process from SAP Build Apps.

  1. Publish your deployed process project.
  2.  In SAP Build Apps, go to Integrations > Add Integration > Library, and select the process you want to expose from within the deployed project (which should appear since the project was published). Click Enable Process. 
  3. In the logic canvas (perhaps in response to a button), drag in a Processes > Trigger Process flow function. 
  4. In the flow function, specify the process to trigger and the inputs for the process.

 

Issues

The main issue was that I was using a destination with OAuth2JWTBearer (user authentication). The above works currently only for OAuth2ClientCredentials. So when @KuroKen explained his solution, I didn't understand because it didn't work for me, and he must of thought I was incompetent or crazy.

I contacted development and they confirmed that I was not crazy, that in fact there was a bug -- the client credentials and user token authentication flows used different flows and the one for user tokens had a bug. My understanding is that that bug was fixed and is awaiting deployment. As always,, no guarantees

Potential pitfall

This solution works like a charm, and restores all the great capabilities of SAP Build Apps flow functions. And as long as long as there are only a few environments, it should work pretty well.

But let's say I have 3 environments, and I create 3 instances of SAP Build Process Automation, each will require its own destination to define the connection from SAP Build Apps. But SAP Build Apps assumes the name of the destination is sap_process_automation_service_user_access. So in a  case where I want to trigger processes in different environments from my app, I think I would have a problem -- though I do not know how common a use case that would be.

I am told that there is no cost or performance issue for creating multiple instances, so that is good.

I assume that I can override the configuration by sending the query parameter for another environment, but I have not tested this.

Hope this helps,

😸

entry.title: Unlocking the Potential of Templates in SAP Build Store: A UX-Led Transformation
entry.content:
In early 2024, we discovered something surprising.
The average user spent just 1 minute and 14 seconds in the SAP Build Store. Even more striking: nearly 60% of users left within 15 seconds.

We had invested in pre-designed, ready-to-use solutions, what we call Templates, to accelerate project creation, reduce repetitive tasks, and improve efficiency across SAP Build. But the data told us something else: the feature was practically invisible.

The challenge: our locked treasure

Why was engagement so low? Our research revealed a few key reasons:

  • Terminology like “Store” and “Ready to Use” was confusing
  • The design was outdated and not aligned with SAP’s Fiori guidelines
  • Navigation was weak, leaving users without clear entry points
  • Most users only discovered the feature via a lobby shortcut. Without it, usage dropped dramatically

We had a powerful capability, but no visibility.

The original design: outdated, unclear, and often overlooked

 

Strategic context and research

This redesign was not done in isolation. It aligned with the SAP Build 2025 strategy, which emphasizes predefined processes and best practices to accelerate time to value.

We also reviewed how similar solutions in the market are positioned. A common theme was the strong emphasis on clarity and discoverability, which reinforced the importance of making SAP’s Templates more visible and actionable

 

The big idea: make Templates impossible to ignore

Our guiding principle was simple: Visibility, Clarity, Efficiency.
If users did not see it, they would not use it.

So the mission was twofold:

  1. Make Templates more discoverable, even without shortcuts
  2. Clarify their purpose so users could quickly understand and act

 

Transformation in action

We redesigned the experience with these goals in mind:

  • Consistency: A modern, structured UI aligned with SAP’s design language
  • Navigation: Clearer pathways and filters so users could find relevant templates more easily
  • Cards: A more engaging presentation with images, clearer actions, and hierarchy
  • Clarity: New status badges and improved copy to reduce confusion
  • Guidance: A new dialog to help users understand the difference between Pre-built and Sample templates
  • Terminology: We also introduced several naming changes to reduce confusion and better reflect the feature’s purpose, such as renaming “Store” to Templates, “Ready to Use” to Pre-built, and “Template” to Sample. These adjustments might look small, but they made the feature’s value clearer and easier to understand.

In short, the redesign turned Templates from a hidden corner into a visible, structured, and valuable part of the experience.

The redesigned templates: clearer hierarchy, modern visuals, and consistent actions..

 New Select Template dialog: shown when creating a template that supports both options, helping users choose between Pre-built and Sample with clearer guidance.

 

Testing with users

To validate the new approach, we ran two usability studies:

  • July 2024: with 6 internal SAP colleagues who used the Store daily
  • December 2024: with 5 SAP customers from Vodafone, AIRBUS, Merck, and Twinnings

The feedback was clear:

  • Users finally understood Templates
  • Many admitted they had not known the feature even existed before
  • Excitement grew as they realized Templates could meaningfully support their workflows

One participant summed it up:

“Positive step to move from Store to Template. The UI is much better from the old Store, it is awesome.”

 

The impact

This redesign has not yet been developed, and there is no confirmed timeline for implementation.
But the usability studies made one thing clear:

  • More visibility → more usage
  • More clarity → more efficiency
  • More usability → more business value

 

Key takeaways

  • Do not wait for permission. If something is broken, fix it
  • Business impact and usability go hand in hand
  • Visibility is everything. If users do not see it, they will not use it

This journey reminded me that some of the most impactful UX work is not about adding new features, but about unlocking the hidden value that already exists.

Have you faced a similar challenge in making an important feature more visible and usable? I’d love to hear how you approached it in your product.

entry.title: “Business Excellence with SAP’s New Clean Core Extensibility Levels: Why, What and How”
entry.content:
1. Introduction:

SAP provides pre-delivered content to run your business. A Clean Core approach means keeping Cloud ERP systems up-to-date, free from unnecessary customizations, and aligned with industry best practices. This gives the benefits of driving innovation-readiness, ensuring seamless future upgrades and reducing technical debt.

1.1 Key guiding principles of a Clean Core

There are five essential guiding principles that contribute to an efficient and sustainable Cloud ERP system:

  1. Processes – Streamlining end-to-end (E2E) business workflows for efficiency.
  2. Integration – Ensuring seamless communication between extensions and core enterprise solutions.
  3. Extensibility – Extending standard software functionality to meet unique organizational needs.
  4. Data – Managing configuration, master, and transactional data effectively.
  5. Operations – Managing infrastructure, upgrades, system monitoring, and maintenance.

In this article, we will focus on the “Extensibility” guiding principle.

To support business differentiation while maintaining a Clean Core, organizations can adopt various extensibility models.  A clean core strategy doesn't mean to exclude extensibility entirely, the crucial part is understanding the appropriate way to implement the extensions.  You can create extensions using SAP Build via “Side-by-side” extensibility (loosely coupled) on BTP (including AI-enhanced pro-code and low-code tools) or through “S/4 HANA On-stack” extensibility (tightly coupled).

2. WHY New Clean Core Extensibility Levels:

SAP has refined its clean core model, evolving from the former three-tier structure to a more detailed four-level concept (A, B, C, and D). Instead of a simple “clean vs. not clean” classification. These levels show how closely your custom extensions align with clean core principles.

This evolution provides greater clarity for extension decisions and simplifies qualification criteria, giving organizations a more practical way to balance innovation with long-term sustainability. It’s about making smarter, future-proof extensibility choices while ensuring business differentiation doesn’t come at the cost of technical debt.

Here’s what it means in practice:

  1. Smarter, future-proof choices – Enable meaningful business differentiation without slowing down with legacy overhead.
  2. Clean, scalable extensions – Build on SAP BTP, ABAP Cloud, and SAP Build—all supported by Joule, SAP’s AI copilot.
  3. Progress you can measure – Monitor and track clean core adoption with tools like the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard and ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC). The dashboards will be updated and reflect the new levels.

3. WHAT are the new clean core extensibility Levels:

Before exploring the new clean core extensibility levels are, it is important to understand what an API is—because most of these levels are closely tied to APIs.

  • An API (Application Programming Interface) is essentially a defined set of rules, protocols, and interfaces that allows one software application to communicate with another.
  • In simple terms, an API acts like a bridge. It lets developers access specific functions, data, or services of a system without needing to dive into, or modify, the underlying code.

There are four extensibility levels from the cleanest form of extensions to not clean extensions.

Level A – The cleanest form of custom extensions. These are built either directly on-stack with the ABAP Cloud development model or side-by-side on SAP BTP using SAP Build, whether through ABAP Cloud, CAP, or low-code/no-code tools. Represents highest standard in SAP extensibility, offering future-ready solutions with maximum upgrade stability by utilizing released API’s and extension points.

Level B –Extensions that follow SAP’s best practices for classic ABAP development and use only officially provided SAP APIs and frameworks. These extensions can be used only if the requirements cannot be fulfilled by set of released APIs (Level A). These include wide range of legacy APIs, user exits, BadIs and established frameworks like SAP GUI and ABAP list viewer grid.

Level C – Extensions at Level C involve the use of SAP internal objects that are not classified or intended for customer use. These objects are neither officially released, recommended, nor cloud-ready, and they fall outside SAP’s formal support scope. However, with the introduction of the new changelog for SAP objects (currently in work and will become later available), customers can proactively analyze and plan for potential upgrade impacts when Level C objects are affected by incompatible changes. For this reason, Level C extensions are considered conditionally clean.

Level D – Classified as not clean core. This level includes extensions that don’t follow SAP’s guidelines, such as system modifications, reliance on non-recommended SAP objects, or unsupported techniques like implicit enhancements.

Below table explains the differences in each level for comparison.

For detailed guidance on frameworks, technologies and development patterns in the context of clean core extensibility, please refer to SAP Note: 3578329.

4. HOW to find SAP extensibility objects classification by levels:

The “SAP Business Accelerator Hub” and “Cloudification Repository (API Viewer)” are the central tools to classify objects by clean core level. It shows which objects are:

  • Released APIs (Level A)
  • Classic APIs (Level B)
  • No APIs (Level D)
  • Internal Objects (Level C – default when not classified as A, B and D)

The SAP API Business Hub is SAP’s central catalog of APIs, integration content, and business services. All the APIs are classified as Level A. Remote APIs are for consumption in BTP and local APIs are for consumption in “On-stack extensibility”.

The Cloudification Repository Viewer is an interactive tool designed to help developers explore API details for “SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public” and “SAP S/4HANA Private Edition” for on-stack extensions.

Links:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition (Doesn’t include Classic APIs)
  • SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition (Classic API’s)

In this article, I will be demonstrating the usage of “S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition”.

4.1 Extension Level A

The cleanest form of custom extensions. These are built either directly on-stack with the ABAP Cloud development model or side-by-side on SAP BTP using SAP Build, whether through ABAP Cloud, CAP, or low-code/no-code tools. You can find the released API’s at SAP Business Accelerator Hub. If you are a developer, you can find the released API’s directly in the IDE (Integrated Development Environment).

 Alternatively, for “SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition" you can follow the below steps.

Detailed Steps:

1. Go to S/4 HANA Cloud ERP Private  (Doesn’t include Classic APIs)
2. Click “Show Filter Bar”

3. Choose “Released” under State drop down.

4. You have different options to filter results based on “Object type”, “Software Component” and “Application Component”

5. You can also search for objects (Example of search results for “purchase_order”)

4.2 Extension Level B – Classics APIs:

Extensions that follow SAP’s best practices for classic ABAP development and use only officially provided SAP APIs and frameworks. These extensions can be used only if the requirements cannot be fulfilled by set of released APIs (Level A). These include wide range of legacy APIs, user exits, BadIs and established frameworks like SAP GUI and ABAP list viewer grid.

Detailed Steps on finding the Classic API’s:

  1. Go to S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition (Classic API’s)
  2. Click “Show Filter Bar”

3. Choose “Classic API” in the state 

4. You can choose filter criteria as needed

5. You can also search for objects (Example of search results for “sales”)

4.3 Extension Level C – Conditionally Clean

Extensions at Level C involve the use of SAP internal objects that are not classified or intended for customer use. These objects are neither officially released, recommended, nor cloud-ready, and they fall outside SAP’s formal support scope. However, with the introduction of the new changelog for SAP objects (currently in work and will become later available), customers can proactively analyze and plan for potential upgrade impacts when Level C objects are affected by incompatible changes. For this reason, Level C extensions are considered conditionally clean.

  • You can find objects in Level A (Released APIs), Level B (Classical APIs) and Level D (No APIs).

Level C refers to all internal SAP objects that are neither “Released APIs,” “Classical APIs,” nor “APIs” at all. Since they are internal objects, no official list exists.

4.4 Extension Level D – Not Clean Core

Extensions at level D are classified as not clean core. These includes extensions that doesn’t follow SAP’s guidelines, such as system modifications, reliance on non-recommended SAP objects, or unsupported techniques like implicit enhancements.

Detailed Steps on finding objects which are “Not APIs” classified as “No APIs”

  1. Go to S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition (Classic API’s)
  2. Click “Show Filter Bar

3. Choose “No API” in State

4. Results with “No APIs” are displayed

5. Successor information is available for some of the objects.

5. Summary:
With this evolved model, SAP is giving organizations a smarter playbook for extension decisions. By aligning with clean core principles on a clear scale (Levels A, B, C and D), businesses can innovate faster, keep their systems future-ready, and reduce technical debt—while still getting the flexibility they need today.

6. References:

No
